text.*:
This article aims to compile various depictions of Thrissur in popular culture.

Films[edit]

Poster of Thoovanathumbikal movie which have a Thrissur background
  • Thoovanathumbikal: Malayalam director Padmarajan's film Thoovanathumbikal was shot in Thrissur city. Almost all the main characters speak with a Thrissur accent for Malayalam. The character played by the lead actor Mohanlal was based on a citizen of Thrissur, Mannarthodi jayakrishnan, and his friends like Vijayan Karot.[1]
  • Pranchiyettan and The Saint: Malayalam director Ranjith's film Pranchiyettan and The Saint is based on Thrissur's Rice Bazaar. Malayalam actor Mammootty plays the lead role of a Thrissur-based rice vendor merchant, Francis aka Ari Pranchi.[2][3]
  • Punyalan Agarbattis: Directed by Ranjith Sankar, Punyalan Agarbattis tell the story of a young entrepreneur from Thrissur city, Joy Thakkolkaran which is played by Jayasurya.[4]
  • Sapthamashree Thaskaraha: Shot in the prime backdrop of Thrissur city, this satire film is directed by Anil Radhakrishnan Menon and tells the story of seven thief’s.[5][6]
  • Mathai Kuzhappakkaranalla: Jayasurya's character from Thrissur does a role of an innocent auto driver who unnecessarily interferes into the problems of others with a good intention of solving them.
  • Punyalan Private Limited a sequence of movie Punyalan Agarbattis directed by Ranjith Sankar released in 2017.[7]
  • Diwanjimoola Grand Prix was the film shot in different locations in and around Thrissur town released in 2018.[8]

Novels[edit]

  • Malayalam writer Sarah Joseph's works are generally set in the background of city of Thrissur and nearby areas.[9]

References[edit]

  1. ^ "Thoovanathumbikal (". The Internet Movie Database. Retrieved 7 April 2010. 
  2. ^ "Pranchiyettan and the Saint". IMDB. Retrieved 22 January 2014. 
  3. ^ "Mammootty in Pranchiyettan and the Saint". Rediff.com. Retrieved 22 January 2014. 
  4. ^ "Jayasuriya turns director". Indiaglitz.com. Retrieved 22 January 2014. 
  5. ^ "Prithviraj's 'Sapthamashree Thaskaraha' Teaser Releases". International Business Times. Retrieved 31 July 2014. 
  6. ^ "Prithviraj as head of thieves in "Sapthamashree Thaskaraha"". Mollywoodframes. Retrieved 31 July 2014. 
  7. ^ "A lead actor called Thrissur". newindianexpress.com. Retrieved 8 September 2017. 
  8. ^ "Diwanjimoola Grand Prix decoded". The new indian express. Retrieved 6 April 2018. 
  9. ^ "Othappu : The Scent of the Other Side/Sarah Joseph". Vedamsbooks.com. Retrieved 22 January 2014.
